thread.title: Teresa Palmer goes makeup-free at Sydney airport | Daily Mail Online
thread.title_full: Teresa Palmer goes makeup-free at Sydney airport | Daily Mail Online

author: Josh Hanrahan
title: Teresa Palmer goes makeup-free at Sydney airport | Daily Mail Online
text: Share She paired the relaxed look with shiny loafers and carried a tan-coloured backpack. Her luscious blonde locks were styled in a messy ponytail and she appeared to be in high spirits as she exchanged laughs with screenwriter Mark. All smiles! The 30-year-old was seemingly headed to the United States with husband Mark Webber, 36, and their young two young children Flying time: The Wolf Creek actress was make-up free and dressed casually for the flight, but enjoyed a laugh with her husband as they walked through the international terminal Lights, camera, action: Teresa recently spoke out about her insecurities in the movie industry With husband Mark pushing a pram and suitcases through the terminal, Teresa put her hand on his arm as the couple chatted away. But while the pair rocked simple outfits, it was young son Bodhi who stole the show in an enormous pair of sunglasses. While the parents appeared to be excited about heading overseas, their two young children seemed to be keen to get on the plane as they stood in line. Having been in the industry for 12 years, one of the Teresa's latest movies Hacksaw Ridge is up for six Oscars on Sunday. Easy work: Balancing three-year-old Bodhi in her arms and three-month-old Forest in a baby carrier was no hassle for the doting mum Balancing act: Wearing black jeans and a striped t-shirt, the actress balanced a bag over her shoulder and two children as she walked through the airport towards the departure gate Are we there yet? While the parents appeared to be excited about heading overseas, their two young children seemed to be keen to get on the plane as they stood in line Loved up: Teresa and Mark married in 2013 after the actress reportedly approached him on Twitter The family's trip comes just days after Teresa told the Courier Mail her insecurities and struggles to 'represent real'. 'I think my industry definitely gives a false sense of reality in some ways, so it is important for me to be as grounded as possible,' she said. 'I am just trying to represent real, it is important for me. I try and be open. It is something that I've always had.' Award season: One of Teresa's most recent films Hackshaw Ridge is up for six Oscars on Sunday Stylish: While the couple rocked simple outfits, it was young son Bodhi who stole the show in his mum's enormous pair of sunglasses Prime position: After starring in several Hollywood films since, the actress is well placed to comment on the pitfalls of the industry she inhabits Talking about Forest the latest addition to their family in December last year, Teresa said their second son has slotted into their life seamlessly. 'He is amazing, he is a ray of sunshine,' she gushed. The quartet were recently pictured together after they'd celebrated Bodhi's third birthday with a pirate-themed party. The crew: The family-of-four were recently pictured together as they celebrated Bodhi's third birthday
